stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on polishing the overworld: modelling new giant fruits, repainting terrain, and shortening corridors while discussing tools, engine quirks, and quality-of-life systems.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is adding multiple giant fruit models (banana, apple, strawberry, honey melon, normal melon, orange, grapes) as interactive scenery in the overworld.
development_findings.quote: Now that the overworld is starting to look like something I'm starting to feel something for the overworld.

development_findings.summary: Re-importing every asset of Course 6 with the current Fast64 exporter unexpectedly removed several long-standing bugs, implying the old 2022 converter produced incompatible geometry.
development_findings.quote: Today I spent all morning re-importing all the assets from Course 6... somehow that fixed a bunch of bugs with Course 6.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 has been updated on GitHub; Kaze needs to merge the pull request after stream to obtain the fixes.
development_findings.quote: After stream I'm gonna be out for sushi so it is going to be a while before I can try it.

development_findings.summary: A pause-menu map will let players warp to any previously entered level entrance, eliminating mandatory back-tracking and reducing concern over overworld travel time.
development_findings.quote: On the map you can select which level entrance you walk to and you can walk to any level entrance that you've entered before.

development_findings.summary: Kaze shortened a long straight path and rebuilt several corridors to remove “vast empty stretches,” improving pacing.
development_findings.quote: Maybe the straight here is a little long… yeah we should shorten that.

development_findings.summary: He implemented an export-label workaround (findFirstMatching) so he no longer needs manual export labels when bringing assets into the game.
development_findings.quote: I will no longer ask for export labels; I now have a solution.

development_findings.summary: Fancy water graphics have already been coded and will be applied to the beach area.
development_findings.quote: Will you be giving this area fancy water graphics too? Yes. We already have the codes.

development_findings.summary: Rope physics exist in code but are not yet applied; Kaze is considering adding sway so poles feel less rigid.
development_findings.quote: I wish there was an easy way to implement it so that ropes also move when you jump on them.

development_findings.summary: Day/night cycles were discussed but rejected because the game was not planned around them.
development_findings.quote: We did not plan it, so we're not adding that.

development_findings.summary: Item-babysitting missions are deliberately avoided; Kaze equates them to a design ‘morphine’ that tempts devs but frustrates players.
development_findings.quote: Putting missions where you babysit items is like taking morphine… it's such an easy idea to come up with but it's such an inconvenient design.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values accessibility; an option will let weaker players cheat rather than stall.
context_findings.quote: It's an accessibility option. I figured we should make it so that even bad players can play the game.

context_findings.summary: He has strong sensory sensitivity, especially to vinegar smells.
context_findings.quote: Zayna cleaned the coffee machine with vinegar yesterday and it was unbearable living in that room.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes tutorials and prefers hands-on experimentation when learning tools like Blender, reflecting a self-directed learning philosophy.
context_findings.quote: All Blender tutorials are pretty awful… just start doing things in it.

context_findings.summary: He openly tracks personal fitness (bench press 263 lb) and plans social time (ending stream early for sushi), showing a balance between work and life.
Kaze sees player time as the true resource in games; hoarding consumables stems from not realizing this.
context_findings.quote: As soon as you realize that your only resource playing Pokémon is time, Pokémon kind of sucks.

biobak.summary: Discovered and shared a useful Blender UV-mapping plugin (Uni-V) that Kaze now relies on.
biobak.quote: This is a very cool plugin that Biobak found.

badub.summary: Composes original soundtrack; was present in chat and is actively scoring the game.

zeina.summary: Cleaned the coffee machine with vinegar (non-dev task) and triggered Kaze’s smell sensitivity.

key_stories.title: Course 6 Bug Exorcism
key_stories.summary: Old geometry in Course 6 caused inexplicable errors. By re-exporting every asset with the latest Fast64, Kaze wiped the issues in one morning.
key_stories.challenge: Persistent Course 6 bugs traced to unknown source.
key_stories.process: Re-imported all Course 6 assets through updated Fast64 exporter.
key_stories.outcome: Bugs vanished; suggests 2022 exporter produced bad data.
key_stories.key_quote: Somehow that fixed a bunch of bugs with Course 6.

key_stories.title: Overworld Too Long
key_stories.summary: Play-testing showed parts of the overworld felt empty and slow. Kaze shortened a major corridor and decided on a map-warp system to remove backtracking.
key_stories.challenge: Long, empty stretches risked boring players.
key_stories.process: Visually inspected path, shifted geometry, and discussed fast-travel via pause menu.
key_stories.outcome: Corridor shortened; warp system confirmed, reducing travel fatigue.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe the straight here is a little long… yeah we should shorten that.

open_questions.context: Kaze mentioned a GitHub pull request he hasn’t merged yet.
questions: What specific features or fixes does the new Fast64 build add?
How will it change your workflow once merged?

open_questions.context: He stated the code is ready but not shown.
questions: What technical approach are you using for the water shader on N64 hardware?
Any performance trade-offs or visual tricks involved?

open_questions.context: Physics exist, not yet applied; concern about jank.
questions: What is the current state of the rope-sway code?
How will you decide whether to ship it?
What is the Retro section’s concept and purpose?
What innovations is Sauraen bringing to it?

open_questions.context: Kaze teased a half-fill-rate technique and upcoming video.
questions: Can you elaborate on the fill-rate trick and how it could apply to RTYI?
Will the hack ship with selectable video modes?

open_questions.context: Multiple fruit models were added but purpose unclear.
questions: Are the fruits purely decorative or will they have gameplay interactions?
How do they reinforce the Yoshi’s Island theme mechanically?
